page.description: Specify the icon to show when the switch is 'On'

figure.title: Custom On icon updating a list

section.description: If you select 'Icon' for the 'Custom Switch type' property, after choosing 'Custom' in the 'Switch type' property, you can then specify your own icon. There are several types of icons that you can use. These include: SVG icons, CSS icons, Images in the Web Project or Style folder, Built-in Images, and URLs to external images.

section.title: Adding images from the Web Project or Style Folder
section.description: This is one of the easier ways to add png, bitmap, jpg, etc... images from a desktop.

step.description: Define the custom 'on' image you want to use
Next click the [...] button next to the 'On icon' property to load the Specify image dialog. By default the icon is set to a small green circle defined in Alpha Anywhere's built-in icons folder.
Select the Image in Web Project or Style radio button, then click 'Select'. Choose "Select from Web Project Folder".
Click the "Add Image to Project" button
Click the up button to specify a Source filename.
Navigate to the icon you want to use and click 'Open'. Then click Ok and Ok again.
Click OK Again to close the Specify Image dialog.
Run the component in Live Preview.
